page.title: 16 Buildings; Papa Westray
page.content: The island is low lying with it's highest point on the North Hill Bird Reserve where there are low sea cliffs. The remainder of the coastline is rocky with three silver sand beaches. The majority of the land is enclosed by dry stane dykes made with local stone. Most of the buildings are long single story, stone built cottages with flagstone roofs. There are a few recently built houses. Holland House is the largest building and is situated in the middle of the island. Parts of the steading date from the 17th century. There are other buildings around it of interest including a circular mill tramp. As the population declines there are many vacant and derelict cottages.
